metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1802 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-1802` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 100.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
firefox-geckodriver - 100.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 100.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '100.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
